column4: How do I set grub to boot a specified kernel (an older one) instead of the one it chooses by default (the newest one)?
just select classic ubuntu from the log in screen bottom right corner pretty much
that's not what I'm asking. I'm running Lucid lol. What I'm asking is how to make GRUB (the boot loader) load a different kernel than the one it selects by default?
so you have them installed and just want to switch
